xplane_export.py

Defines Classes used to create OBJ files out of XPlane data types defined in xplane_types.py.

Summary
xplane_export.pyDefines Classes used to create OBJ files out of XPlane data types defined in xplane_types.py.
XPlaneMeshCreates the OBJ meshes.
Properties
vertices
indices
globalindex
Functions
__init__
getBakeMatrixReturns the bake matrix of a XPlaneObject.
writeObjectsFills the vertices and indices from a list of XPlaneObjects.
getDupliVerticeIndexReturns the index of a vertice duplicate if any.
getUVFacesReturns Blender the UV faces of a Blender mesh.
getTriangulatedMeshReturns a triangulated mesh from a given Blender object.
faceToTrianglesWithUVConverts a Blender face (3 or 4 sided) into one or two 3-sided faces together with the texture coordinates.
faceValuesReturns the converted vertices of a face.
writeVerticesReturns the OBJ vertex table by iterating vertices.
writeIndicesReturns the OBJ indices table by itering indices.

XPlaneMesh

Creates the OBJ meshes.

Summary
Properties
vertices
indices
globalindex
Functions
__init__
getBakeMatrixReturns the bake matrix of a XPlaneObject.
writeObjectsFills the vertices and indices from a list of XPlaneObjects.
getDupliVerticeIndexReturns the index of a vertice duplicate if any.
getUVFacesReturns Blender the UV faces of a Blender mesh.
getTriangulatedMeshReturns a triangulated mesh from a given Blender object.
faceToTrianglesWithUVConverts a Blender face (3 or 4 sided) into one or two 3-sided faces together with the texture coordinates.
faceValuesReturns the converted vertices of a face.
writeVerticesReturns the OBJ vertex table by iterating vertices.
writeIndicesReturns the OBJ indices table by itering indices.

Properties

vertices

listcontains all mesh vertices

indices

listcontains all face indices

globalindex

intStores the current global vertex index.

Functions

__init__

def __init__(self,
file)

Parameters

dict fileA file dict coming from XPlaneData

getBakeMatrix

def getBakeMatrix(self,
obj)

Returns the bake matrix of a XPlaneObject.  The bake matrix is the matrix the object vertices will be transformed with before they are written to the OBJ.  It depends on the object hierarchy and animation.

Parameters

XPlaneObject objA XPlaneObject

Returns

MatrixThe bake matrix for this object.

writeObjects

def writeObjects(self,
objects)

Fills the vertices and indices from a list of XPlaneObjects.  This method works recursively on the children of each XPlaneObject.

Parameters

listlist of XPlaneObjects.

getDupliVerticeIndex

def getDupliVerticeIndex(self,  
v,  
startIndex =  0)

Returns the index of a vertice duplicate if any.

Parameters

vThe OBJ vertice.
int startIndex(default=0) From which index to start searching for duplicates.

Returns

intIndex of the duplicate or -1 if none was found.

getUVFaces

def getUVFaces(self,
mesh,
uv_name)

Returns Blender the UV faces of a Blender mesh.

Parameters

meshBlender mesh
string uv_nameName of the uv layer to use.  If not given the first layer will be used.

Returns

None if no UV faces could be found or the Blender UV Faces.

getTriangulatedMesh

def getTriangulatedMesh(self,
object)

Returns a triangulated mesh from a given Blender object.

Parameters

objectBlender object

Returns

A Blender mesh

Todos

  • Does not remove temporarily created mesh/object yet.

faceToTrianglesWithUV

def faceToTrianglesWithUV(self,
face,
uv)

Converts a Blender face (3 or 4 sided) into one or two 3-sided faces together with the texture coordinates.

Parameters

faceA Blender face.
uvUV coordiantes of a Blender UV face.

Returns

list[{‘uv’:[[u1,v1],[u2,v2],[u3,v3]],’indices’:[i1,i2,i3]},..]  In length 1 or 2.

faceValues

def faceValues(self,
face,
mesh,
matrix)

Returns the converted vertices of a face.

Parameters

faceA Blender face.
meshA Blender mesh.
Matrix matrixThe conversion matrix.

Returns

listList of vertices.

writeVertices

def writeVertices(self)

Returns the OBJ vertex table by iterating vertices.

Returns

stringThe OBJ vertex table.

writeIndices

def writeIndices(self)

Returns the OBJ indices table by itering indices.

Returns

stringThe OBJ indices table.

Creates the OBJ commands table.

Summary
Properties
reseters
written

Functions

writeReturns the OBJ commands table.
writeObjectReturns the commands for one XPlaneObject.
getAnimTabsReturns the tabs used to indent the commands for better readibility in the OBJ file.
getAnimLevelReturns the animation level of an XPlaneObject.
writeAttributeReturns the Command line for an attribute.
parseAttributeValueReturns a string with the parsed attribute value (replacing insert tags)
canWriteDetermines if an attribute must be written.
attributeIsReseterDetermines if a given attribute is a resetter.
writeCustomAttributesReturns the commands for custom attributes of a XPlaneObject.
writeCockpitAttributesReturns the commands for a XPlaneObject cockpit related attributes (e.g.
writeResetersReturns the commands for a XPlaneObject needed to reset previous commands.
writeAnimAttributesReturns the commands for animation attributes of a XPlaneObject.
writeMaterialReturns the commands for a XPlaneObject material.
writeKeyframesReturns the commands for a XPlaneObject keyframes.

Properties

reseters

dictStores attribtues that reset other attributes.

written

dictStores all already written attributes and theire values.

staticWritten

listStores names of objects whos static translations/rotations have already been written.

Functions

Returns the OBJ commands table.

Returns

stringThe OBJ commands table.

writeObject

def writeObject(self,
obj,
animLevel)

Returns the commands for one XPlaneObject.

Parameters

XPlaneObject objA XPlaneObject.
int animLevelLevel of animation.

Returns

stringOBJ Commands for the “obj”.

getAnimTabs

def getAnimTabs(self,
level)

Returns the tabs used to indent the commands for better readibility in the OBJ file.

Parameters

int levelLevel of animation.

Returns

stringThe tabs.

getAnimLevel

def getAnimLevel(self,
obj)

Returns the animation level of an XPlaneObject.  This is basically the nesting level of an object.

Parameters

XPlaneObject objA XPlaneObject.

Returns

intthe animation level.

writeAttribute

def writeAttribute(self,
attr,
value,
object)

Returns the Command line for an attribute.  Uses canWrite to determine if the command needs to be written.

Parameters

string attrThe attribute name.
string valueThe attribute value.
XPlaneObject objectA XPlaneObject.

Returns

string or None if the command must not be written.

parseAttributeValue

def parseAttributeValue(self,
value,
object)

Returns a string with the parsed attribute value (replacing insert tags)

Parameters

string valueThe attribute value.
XPlaneObject objectA XPlaneObject.

Returns

stringThe value with replaced insert tags.

canWrite

def canWrite(self,
attr,
value)

Determines if an attribute must be written.

Parameters

string attrThe attribute name.
string valueThe attribute value.

Returns

boolTrue if the attribute must be written, else false.

attributeIsReseter

def attributeIsReseter(self,  
attr,  
reseters =  None)

Determines if a given attribute is a resetter.

Parameters

string attrThe attribute name
dict resetersoptional (default = self.reseters) a dict of reseters

Returns

boolTrue if attribute is a reseter, else False

def writeCustomAttributes(self,
obj,
tabs)

Returns the commands for custom attributes of a XPlaneObject.

Parameters

XPlaneObject objA XPlaneObject
string tabsThe indentation tabs.

Returns

stringCommands

tabs)

string tabsThe indentation tabs.

Returns

stringCommands

obj,
tabs)

obj,

XPlaneObject objA XPlaneObject

string tabsThe indentation tabs.

Returns

stringCommands

XPlaneData

Collects Blender data relevant for export and converts it to Classes from xplane_types.py.  It handles multi-file export.

Summary
Properties
files
Functions
__init__
getXPlaneLayerReturns the corresponding XPlaneLayer for a Blender layer index.
getFilenameFromXPlaneLayerReturns the filename for a XPlaneLayer.
getActiveLayersReturns indices of all active Blender layers.
getObjectsByLayerReturns all first level Objects of a Blender layer.
getEmptyFileReturns an empty OBJ-file dict.
getChildObjectsReturns exportable Blender child objects.
collectCollects all exportable Blender objects from the scene in files.
collectBonesGenerates and collects XPlaneBones from Blender bones.
collectBoneObjectsCollects all Childobjects of an XPlaneBone.
collectObjectsGenerates and collects XPlaneObjects from Blender objects.
getBoneReturns a bone from an armature.
splitFileByTextureSplits files by textures.

Properties

files

dictContains all files to be exported.

Functions

__init__

def __init__(self)

getXPlaneLayer

def getXPlaneLayer(self,
layer)

Returns the corresponding XPlaneLayer for a Blender layer index.

Parameters

int layerThe Blender layer index.

Returns

XPlaneLayerThe XPlaneLayer.

getFilenameFromXPlaneLayer

def getFilenameFromXPlaneLayer(self,
xplaneLayer)

Returns the filename for a XPlaneLayer.  If no name was given by the user it will be generated by the following pattern: “layer_[index]”.

Paramters

XPlaneLayer xplaneLayerA XPlaneLayer.

Returns

stringThe filename.

getActiveLayers

def getActiveLayers(self)

Returns indices of all active Blender layers.

Returns

listIndices of all active blender layers.

getObjectsByLayer

def getObjectsByLayer(self,
layer)

Returns all first level Objects of a Blender layer.

Parameters

int layerThe Blender layer index.

Returns

listBlender Oobjects.

getEmptyFile

def getEmptyFile(self,
parent)

Returns an empty OBJ-file dict.

Paramters

XPlaneLayer parentThe XPlaneLayer this file will be generated from.

getChildObjects

def getChildObjects(self,  
parent,  
found =  None)

Returns exportable Blender child objects.  If those are nested within bones or something else it will look recursive for objects.

Parameters

parentA Blender object to look for children in.
list foundUsed internally.  Contains all already found objects.

Returns

listAll found child objects.

collect

def collect(self)

Collects all exportable Blender objects from the scene in files.

collectBones

def collectBones(self,
bones,
filename,
parent)

Generates and collects XPlaneBones from Blender bones.  Uses collectBoneObjects.

Parameters

list bonesBlender bones.
string filenameOBJ filename in files.
parentBlender object the bones are children of.

collectBoneObjects

def collectBoneObjects(self,
xplaneBone,
filename)

Collects all Childobjects of an XPlaneBone.

Parameters

XPlaneBone xplaneBoneA XPlaneBone.
string filenameOBJ filename in files.

collectObjects

def collectObjects(self,  
objects,  
filename,  
parent =  None)

Generates and collects XPlaneObjects from Blender objects.

Parameters

listBlender objects
string filenameOBJ filename in files.
parentNone or the parent XPlaneObject.

getBone

def getBone(self,
armature,
name)

Returns a bone from an armature.

Parameters

armatureBlender armature.
string nameBone name.

Returns

None, if bone could not be found or Blender bone.

splitFileByTexture

def splitFileByTexture(self,
parent)

Splits files by textures.  This is depricated as files/textures are now defined per layer.

Todos

  • not working with new nested export.  Propably XPlane Layers must hold texture info?

XPlaneHeader

Create an OBJ header.

Summary
Properties
versionOBJ format version
modeThe OBJ file mode.
attributes
Functions
__init__
writeReturns the OBJ header.

Properties

version

OBJ format version

mode

The OBJ file mode.  (“default” or “cockpit”).  This is currently not in use, I think.

attributes

OrderedDictKey value pairs of all Header attributes

Functions

__init__

def __init__(self,
exportpath,
file,
mesh,
lights,
version)

Parameters

string exportpathfilepath to the destiantion directory
dict fileA file dict coming from XPlaneData.
XPlaneMesh meshA XPlaneMesh.
XPlaneLights lightsXPlaneLights
int versionOBJ format version.

write

def write(self)

Returns the OBJ header.

Returns

stringOBJ header

ExportXPlane9

Main Export class.  Brings all parts together and creates the OBJ files.

Summary
Functions
executeUsed from Blender when user invokes export.
invokeUsed from Blender when user hits the Export-Entry in the File>Export menu.

Functions

execute

def execute(self,
context)

Used from Blender when user invokes export.  Invokes the exporting.

Parameters

contextBlender context object.

invoke

def invoke(self,
context,
event)

Used from Blender when user hits the Export-Entry in the File>Export menu.  Creates a file select window.

Todos

  • window does not seem to work on Mac OS.  Is there something different in the py API?
